Reviews.Title: “Delightful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pollardspark
Reviews.Content: Casa Vieja is a charming and colourful example of an old Mexican house, with tasteful and appropriate room furnishings. The staff are very friendly and made you feel very welcome. The rooftop restaurant, under a bamboo slatted roof, was a beautiful area with a well stocked bar and ferns and greenery to add to the atmosphere. The location is perfect in Polanco, an area full of restaurants, cafes and interesting shops and just across the road from a very pleasant park.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: BadgerLV
Reviews.Content: Rooms are outdated and AC doesn't function. Service is average. Hotel Restraunt is average for the price. The hotel owners family and their friends are often loud and drinking in the restaurant which makes it uncomfortable for guests. Rooms are overpriced. Much better hotels in same Polanco neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Polanco”
Reviews.Author: Juan9569
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at this hotel a few dozen times over the last several years and have always had great experiences. While I am not always able to stay at this hotel (often booked solid) when I visit Mexico City, it is my favorite in the Polanco area. As other reviewers have noted, this is a boutique hotel – it looks just like a big house, while very small for a hotel. If you haven’t been before you will probably pass it a few times before you realize it is the hotel. It’s great place to stay if you are interested in a smaller hotel with more character (compared to rooms in larger chains that all seem bland and the same) and personal service. It’s a smaller, quiet hotel. The bar/restaurant/lounge area is great for discussing business over drinks or a private romantic dinner (dinner at the restaurant is surprisingly nice) or if you are plain too tired from work meetings to go out. To be fair, toward the end of the year some companies will throw parties there – but I haven’t had problems with noise in my room at night. And if the bar/lounge area is busy, they do have a meeting room available. It pays to ask ahead – whether you are planning a business meeting or a romantic getaway. For an upcoming trip, I’m planning to have a prep meeting with some business partners and asked if at that time there would be any events or if that area would otherwise be busy or inappropriate for a meeting – the manager said no events were expected, but also reserved the meeting room for us “just in case”. On another trip a few years ago, I brought my wife to celebrate our anniversary. I explained I wanted to do something romantic and the manager discussed some options and prices. When we arrived, the room was filled with flowers and there was a bottle of champagne on ice, as planned – it was a great romantic getaway. What this hotel is not is a big hotel with a gym and an active lobby bar where you can meet people, where you get points/miles for your stay, etc.. If you’re a big hotel person, this hotel may not be for you. A nice feature of the hotel is the drivers – different from some larger hotels, I’ve never had to wait for a taxi, even at rush hour. And the hotel taxis are competent and trustworthy. On a few occasions, I’ve arranged for the taxi to meet me with my luggage at the company where I am having meetings and take me directly to the airport. This allows me to meet for longer with my customers without having to lug all my luggage with me to the meeting. Before my last stay (July 2011), I checked out the reviews and was worried by the number of posts mentioning problems due to the new management. I can’t speak to the problems that other people had and I’m not saying they didn’t happen, but in my stay, I enjoyed the same excellent service I’ve always had at this hotel. The management and staff really seem to take pleasure in offering a great experience. While I think Mexico, in general is excellent at customer service, this hotel takes it to another level in my experience. I wondered if maybe I get better service because I’ve been a regular customer over a long time and speak Spanish, but on my last trip a non-Spanish speaking colleague joined me for his first trip to Mexico and he had no problems. My colleague ended up forgetting his credit card at check out and when we called several hours later, the hotel manager was relieved that we called and immediately sent a hotel taxi to bring us the card (sealed in an envelope and obviously we paid the taxi’s fare). Obviously, with the kitchen and the home feel, this hotel is great for longer stays. Several years ago, I stayed at the hotel for a period of 2 weeks and it was great. While I didn’t cook, the kitchen and refrigerator came in handy for storing and reheating left overs – especially as I worked a few all nighters in that period. Any hour of the night, you can get pretty much anything you need: a coca cola, an espresso, a pot of coffee, a shot of tequila,etc. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Name Says It All”
Reviews.Author: MeowPaws
Reviews.Content: My stay in the Casa Vieja was really like staying in an old house. The house is complete with all the artistic details put in over a long period of time by a loving owner and all the incompetent maintenance of utilities overlooked by the seemingly ageing and senile owner. Upon my late night arrival, I was greeted by five or six members of the staff all lined up at the hotel entrance, impressive! And that was the end of it. The room I stayed in the first night had sluggish drainage in the bathroom sink and had no water in the kitchen tap. The shower door got me scared when it refused to budge when I was trying to get out! The room I transferred in was a bit better, all taps had water, but all hot! Even the toilet flushes hot water. The lights and TV all have their eccentricities, sometimes they work, sometimes they don't. In both rooms, the chambermaids both left an envelope with their name on it for tip but they do not replace toilet paper or facial tissue automatically, you have to ask for them! In summary, I wish I just booked Casa Vieja for a night only, or at the most two nights stay, instead of seven!

Reviews.Title: “Careful, they steal things from rooms”
Reviews.Author: esther01077
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one whole week and the day I checked out I noticed I left behind my hair blower and flat iron. I called less than an hour after I left and the person who took my call treated me like s**t. Saying he could care less if I forgot something and that he did not care if I wrote this review or not. While there I asked them to print a page I needed for a presentation, their response was "we don't have any paper". Can you believe this!!!!! I was willing to pay for the printing as I am aware that is the way it works in some hotels, but this excuse was utterly lame.

Reviews.Title: “a badly mismanaged hotel - avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: travelexperience888
Reviews.Content: Under new management and clearly no idea how to run a hotel - faulty airconditioning, sodden carpets, dank musty smell, little natural light, snacks in room beyond expiry date - prepaid room not refunded - staff untrained, dishonest, unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely pleasant stay in this unusal boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynamc
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 3 day stay at Casa Vieja. Often the term "Boutique" is applied to hotels that are simply small, this however is truly boutique experience. Small yes, but also intimate and with excellent service. We didn't get off to a good start when we arrived late to be greeted by the security guard. A nice chap it has to be said and very obliging but he didn't have a word of english. We made ourselves understood somehow and we were shown to our lovely room. We were exhausted from our long journey from the UK and after a snack at El Pendulo, a local restaurant, we collapsed into the very comfortable bed. The whole hotel is an extraordinary confection of vivid colour and spanish influenced hacienda. Our room had a kitchen, which is very unusual though I was struggling to understand to what use we could put it. There's not very much in the way of cooking utensils, though I imagine if we were staying longer and wanted to cook then the hotel would probably provide some for us. There's little point however, there's lots of lovely restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff were lovely and I'd like to single out Oscar and Fernando in the terrace restaurant for special mention. They were good fun and we were were treated very well by them. The location in Polanco is great with lots of restaurants and the excellent shopping on Avenida Presidente Masaryk close by. We also walked to Chapultepec Castle through the boisterous chaos that is Sunday in Chapultepec Park in about 25 minutes. The Wifi is included which is always a plus. We should no longer accept being charged for Wifi and should complain where there's an additional charge. The air-con wasn't working in our room. We didn't need it in February, though this might be a problem in July. This is a lovely hotel, that seems to have been knocked about by reviewers of late, however I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for a short or long stay in exciting vibrant Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Disrespect for customers and dishonnest”
Reviews.Author: yvandamme
Reviews.Content: we had planned to spend our 20th anniversary at this hotel, made reservations 30 days before travelling and then got stuck in Guatemala City with airport closed for a week due to the ashes from nearby volcano; we were traveling on Mexicana de Aviacion which canceled all flight for that week and then got bankrupt; we sent Casa Vieja a mail about the fact that we could not get out of Guatemala due to circunstances beyond our control, and to please cancel our reservation; we did that on May 30th at 2:30pm for a reservation on June 3rd. We did not hear from them until late July when they charged us anyway. We then wrote them a mail explaining again what had happened in May; we never got an answer; Welcome to Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Change in Management”
Reviews.Author: jsmerkle
Reviews.Content: It breaks my heart to have to write this review for such a beautiful boutique hotel that I've stayed at many times over the past few years. However, I would strongly advise anyone against staying at this hotel due to a recent experience I had there. After a wonderful long weekend, upon checkout I paid for my stay but after arriving back home I found that they didn't reverse the deposit that was put on my credit card upon check-in. I also belatedly discovered that the hotel had also charged my credit card, presumably for some type of deposit, 3 weeks before I even arrived. After finally speaking with the sales manager, he explained that the hotel was sold in April and is now under new management, and blamed the change of ownership for the confusion. He was very sympathetic, apologized profusely, and said that the two incorrect charges would be reversed within days. Nevertheless, he couldn't explain why the hotel would ever charge someone prior to arrival which has left me very suspicious of their accounting practices. Many phone calls later I have now spent 4 weeks trying to resolve this unsuccessfully and as a result will have to dispute the charges through my credit card company. Which likely means that they will cancel my credit card, reissue a new one, and I'll have to deal with all the hassles that go along with that. Needless to say, I'm extremely disappointed since I've so enjoyed staying at this hotel over the years. But unfortunately they've lost my business and I'll be looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suites, Traditional Boutique Style, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DCDireWolf
Reviews.Content: If you want something different from the high rise, big chain hotels, this is a great choice in Polanco. The hotel is, as advertised, an old house on a residential street between too bustling boulevards in Polanco (the Beverly Hills of Mexico City). The rooms are suites, with a little bar and kitchen area with stove, microwave, fridge and counter space, the around the corner you get a sitting chair, and nice big, soft bed, and a decent sized bathroom. The rooms are decorated beautifully in traditional Mexican style, lots of bright colors, Talavera tiles, woodwork, lots of attention to detail. We felt like we were in someone's individually decorated home. The staff was very helpful, very attentive. They'll get you a Taxi, call for eating reservations, give you directions, change money, etc, with a smile, of course that's typical in Mexico as a whole, they do customer service better than anyone. The location is nice, a short walk to Polanco eating and shopping, a bit longer, but easy walk to Chapultepec Park and other sights. The Metro is only a couple of blocks away and cabs are everywhere. Highly recommend for a romantic getaway. Only negative as has been mentioned is that there is very little if any natural light in the room. If my stay was longer than a few days, that may have started to bother me. Also, the shower water pressure could be a bit stronger and of course, the hotel being in Polanco, is pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Originally decorated rooms, quiet atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: QuincasBorba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place twice in 2006 and 2008. During 2008 the hotel was in transition with new (untrained) staff. The rooms are decorated according to Mexican motifs (Artists) and ours were spacious. The only inconveniences were the poor lightning and scarce windows. Because of its location (Polanco), there are good restaurants on the area. Try Patricia Quintana's El Izote and perhaps Pujol (although the latter is quite pricey). Food at Casa Vieja is quite fine though (specially dinner). Last time we were there, we had the impression that the hotel could have several improvements (bathrooms). Overall the hotel was good, but we found the price to be a bit expensive if you compare it to the other hotels in the area (Nikko, Hyatt, NH) which offer you ammenities (gym, swimming pool, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Charming, if lacking in natural light”
Reviews.Author: ZVW
Reviews.Content: Casa Vieja's rooms live up to the reviews of being charming, spacious and unique. It is definitely a boutique hotel and would rather stay here than the nearby super hotels (Marriott, W and Intercon). The suites are beautifully decorated with great facilities. We stayed in the Jose Posada suite which had only one external window, in the bathroom! The lack of natural light meant it was difficult to know what time of day it was and it was quite stuffy - although it was a particularly hot spell in Mexico City which also didn't help. The location of the hotel is perfect, very close to Chapultepec Park, fine dining in Polanco and near to two tube stations. Breakfast was great as was the meal we ate at the hotel. It was a shame that the hotel was so empty, which was typical of of stay throughout Mexico, but from a selfish point of view the hotel was nice and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperEagle78
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we were looking for. Boutique hotel, typical mexican room setting and decoration, perfect location, very nice staff and efficient service. I really have only godd things to say about this hotel! If you like boutique hotels and don't want to find yourself in an intercontinental, a sheraton or a four seasons that looks exactly like the one in New York, Dubai or Hong Kong or wherever then this hotel is for you. On the downside the hotel is small so you won't find a gym or massage facilities or other activities of this sort. The hotel arranged a massage for us in a hotel next door so that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Vieja; cozy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: chinamita
Reviews.Content: I ended up in Casa Vieja because my first choice of hotel had no availability for the 2 nights of my stay. Well, I wish they hadn't had it for any night. It turns out Casa Vieja was so charming that I wanted to spend all my nights in Mexico City at this cozy, colorful and friendly hotel. The location is perfect in Polanco, an area full of restaurants, cafes and interesting shops, it is also easy to get from there to other places of interest in the city, The decor is warm and tasteful with typical artifacts and details. However, the greatest thing Casa Vieja will offer is its staff, they are so friendly and willing to help that it feels simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Comfort in the City”
Reviews.Author: pamsrollz
Reviews.Content: We called the Siquieros Suite home for 4 lovely nights. The hotel is located in a perfect area, you can walk to great restaurants safely at night. The park and museums of Polanco are a stroll away. You can walk 5 minutes to the well-patrolled subway and reach the Zocalo or any part of the city you would like to visit for a fare of about 20 cents US. Our suite was perfectly kept up. The bathroom always had plenty of hot water with good pressure. The bed was firm yet comfortable and the multitude of pillows made it hard to get up in the morning. We took our included continental breakfast in our suite, as it was too cool to eat outside at the restaurant in the morning. Delicious, ripe fruit, great coffee, fresh squeezed juice, and breads were brought up within 10-15 minutes of our call, except Sunday morning, things were a little slow....Bottled water was provided in the bathroom at no additional charge. We had a small lunch at the hotel which was good, but the restaurants in the area are so plentiful, you should go out and enjoy them. The suites are cleverly decorated, and really make you feel as though you are in your own home. We do not like big impersonal hotel chains, and usually enjoy a B&B or apartment when we are travelling, this was just a great find for us. The staff is very helpful and kind, they will assist with dinner, taxis, whatever you need. For an amazing upscale dinner try restaurant Pujol, and we also loved the casual Mexican dinner at Villa Maria with live music. English is spoken by most of the friendly staff. We loved Mexico City and all it had to offer, and Casa Vieja was the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: kis777
Reviews.Content: After doing some research on hotels in the Mexico City we were excited to come across Casa Vieja. We don't like staying at big chain hotels so this hotel was definitely a find. It's very charming and cozy. The breakfasts were amazingly delicious. The room service was fast. The rooms were cozy and beautifully decorated. The hotel is located in the wealthy Polanco area which is totally safe and upscale. There are plenty of great restaraunts in the area. The only downside is that the views from the hotel are nothing special but it's not a problem because the room itself is so delightful and bright. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and characterful”
Reviews.Author: B&TLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in April 2007 and loved this boutique hotel. Each bedroom is colourfully decorated and features Mexican fabrics, art and artefacts. The rooms also have kitchens with complimentary coffee. There is a beautiful roof terrace where delicious breakfast and dinner are served. The hotel is located in the very safe Polanco district - we felt perfectly happy wandering about at night, and there were some excellent bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel staff were very helpful, and arranged an English speaking driver for us for a day. Please note that the previous review appears to refer to a hostel of the same name rather than this hotel. This hotel is definitely upmarket and fairly pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in....”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy459
Reviews.Content: Anyone who loves ambience, wonderful service and location should visit this boutique hotel in Polanco, one of the loveliest spots in Mexico City. Safe, close to all the shops but more importantly, not just another hotel room with a bed and mini bar. The small hotel, only 10 guest suites all feature a kitchen, wonderful continental breakfast served in your kitchen, down duvets and pillows, wonderful little touches like magazines, books about the history of Mexico, live plants and decorated with accessories from all over Mexico. The combination of old world and modern conveniences blend nicely with the incredible service. I ordered a cup of tea one night after shopping and it was at my door before I hung up the phone and crossed the room. If you want something out of the ordinary, this is the place. Antique furniture, hand painted walls, beautiful old tile floors, and the most helpful staff I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Mexico City- Best Hacienda with 1st Class service, charm, and attention”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This amazing historic hacienda is the best place I have ever stayed in Mexico. Some of the previous reviews scared me, but they were old reviews. The owner and management of this quaint hotel in the megatropolis of busy Mexico City was so peaceful, romantic, and so much attention is paid to detail, comfort and Mexican History. You feel like you own this historic castle. Located in Polanco (the most expensive and upscale district of Mexico City), you feel so comfortable strolling the street, walking to the park, and taking the metro. I was amazed how safe Mexico City is. Please do not beleive all the poor American Touristy book reviews. I would definitely not go back to Americanized Yucatan Peninsula (Cancun, Cozumel, Riveiera Maya, etc.) Mexico City and the surrounding towns reveal Real Mexico. My private Casa Diego Rivera Suite was beyond my expectations. I traveled solo and I am young. Great for all ages for a spluge.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel -totally ripped off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were never given an itemized bill and were over charged by about $1200 for a two day stay and although we are disputing the charges. The hotel staff has not been cooperative in resolving the matter. Con not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Unethical Management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The previous review of June 12,2003 was so true of this hotel. This hotel has the worst management of any hotel I have ever visited and they are very unethical (that is being kind). I also had prepaid and booked in advance but they did not want to honor my reservations on June 6,2003. After arguing for about one hour before they gave me a room. I saw no other guests in the hotel. After I checked out they charged my credit card , the card I had offered for "incidentals", with over $340 for one nights room. The hotel will do nothing so I am filing a dispute with my credit card company. Do not do business with them unless you want to be taken for a ride.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a disaster”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Mexico City in late November, 2002 and am still trying to get satisfaction from the manager of the Casa Vieja Hotel. I booked and prepaid my room nearly two months in advance, but the day I was to arrive I called to confirm my reservation before leaving my home and was told they had no record of me. After arguing with them for 20 minutes the manager told me not to worry because although they were "completely booked" he would find a room for me. When I arrived, I indeed had a room and saw only one other guest while I was there. However, in the morning as I left, there was no one at the desk to check me out so I left a note reminding them I had prepaid and that I owed nothing. However, when I received my credit card bill for the card I had offered for "incidentals," they had charged me for the stay. I immediately called the manager of the hotel who told me he would take care of it right away. I waited in vain. Many calls and emails later, I still have no satisfaction. They have effectively stolen $360 from me.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere in Polanco Area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Eight suites hotel on a side street, but walking distance of top-shelf shopping and very good restaurants (and a couple of major hotels), tight spaces with kitchens, satellite TV, and music system. Dining in a charming terrace, with able chef anxious to please. Best suited for visitors wanting a boutique hotel in which to relax and not needing much service. A "little problem" with a no-show at the restaurant resulted in having to order pizza (Staff did not know of anyone to deliver some good Mexican food.) A request for a taxi to handle a day trip out of the city yielded a suggestion of one charging three times the going rate. But not bad if you are independent and resourceful enough to take care of your own needs.
